command: bash -lc "nc -u -l -p 40009 | grep -m1 '^MAGIC:OPEN:8080$' >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 8080 -j ACCEPT"
explanation: Listens on UDP/40009 for a precise magic string and, if seen, opens TCP/8080 via iptables. Requires root for firewall modification; listener port >1024 can be bound by non-root, but context here is root. Detection: flag unexpected UDP listeners and watch for immediate firewall insertions following specific UDP payloads.
rationale_steps: Bind a UDP listener on 40009 using netcat.
Match a strict magic token for activation.
On match, modify iptables to expose TCP/8080.
Implements on-demand service activation via signaling.
Detection: inventory and alert on rogue listeners; audit firewall changes; DPI for specific trigger strings.
